intro: Hasseltia yanachagaensis, commonly known as the Yanachaga heather, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in the spring. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
